alert.note: Alert for San Diego (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 14 at 1:29PM PDT until August 14 at 5:30PM PDT by NWS SanDiego
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 418 PM PDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of Southwest California, including the following county, San Diego. * WHEN...Until 418 PM PDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 125 PM PDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.25 to 0.5 inches in about 1 hour, with locally heavier amounts are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Hwy 78 Between Banner And S2, Mount Laguna, Cuyamaca Rancho State Park, Julian, Hwy 78 Between S2 And Borrego Springs Rd, Borrego Springs, I-8 Between Pine Valley And Boulevard, I-8 Between Boulevard And Imperial County Line, Hwy S2 Between Shelter Valley And Agua Caliente, Hwy S1 Between Lake Cuyamaca And Mount Laguna, Lake Cuyamaca, Hwy 79 Between Julian And Lake Cuyamaca, Pine Valley, Hwy S2 Between Hwy 79 And Hwy 78, Hwy S22 Between Ranchita And Borrego Springs, Ranchita, Hwy S2 Between Agua Caliente And Canebrake, Descanso, Borrego Palm Canyon and Fish Creek Wash. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
